alert.note: Alert for Kings (Brooklyn); Northern Nassau; Northern Queens; Southern Nassau; Southern Queens (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 4:54AM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Kings, Queens, and Nassau Counties through 545 AM EDT... At 453 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Little Neck to Canarsie. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Great Neck, Bayside, Whitestone and Little Neck around 500 AM. Port Washington, Manhasset and Sands Point around 505. Woodmere, Cedarhurst and Atlantic Beach around 510. Valley Stream, Long Beach, Glen Cove, Lynbrook, Elmont and Brookville around 515. Oceanside around 520. Freeport, Garden City, Syosset, Mineola, Oyster Bay, Hempstead and Baldwin around 525. Westbury around 530. Levittown and Hicksville around 540. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Kings (Brooklyn); Northern Nassau; Northern Queens; Southern Nassau; Southern Queens
